translated: . The Exposition🔽… the special combination of consciousness with the things associated with it in the Abhidhamma.

original: Yassa kusalaṁ cittaṁ uppajjati …pe… yassa akusalaṁ cittaṁ uppajjati … yassa abyākataṁ cittaṁ uppajjati … yassa sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ cittaṁ uppajjati … ?
analyzed: yassa kusalam cittam uppajjati pe yassa akusalam cittam uppajjati yassa abyākatam cittam uppajjati yassa sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam cittam uppajjati  /
translated: In the case of the profitable consciousness that arises … in the case of the unprofitable consciousness that arises … in the case of the indeterminate consciousness that arises … in the case of the consciousness accompanied by pleasant feeling that arises …
(In this way the whole list of types of consciousness is to be worked out in detail up to the “unbinding through non-conflict” ).

original: Yassa araṇaṁ cittaṁ uppajjati na nirujjhati tassa araṇaṁ cittaṁ nirujjhissati na uppajjissati?
analyzed: yassa araṇam cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati tassa araṇam cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati
translated: In the case of the consciousness that is free from conflict and arises but does not cease, does the consciousness that is free from conflict cease but not arise?

original: Yassa vā pana araṇaṁ cittaṁ nirujjhissati na uppajjissati tassa araṇaṁ cittaṁ uppajjati na nirujjhati?
analyzed: yassa vā pana araṇam cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati tassa araṇam cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati
translated: Or, in the case of the consciousness that is free from conflict and ceases but does not arise, does the consciousness that is free from conflict arise but not cease?
The Exposition in Terms of the Modes of Conveying
